oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Trench Art
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Bored soldiers during WWI began to use empty shell casings to create art. By the end of the war, a cottage industry had developed and taleneted soldiers and French civilians sold their works to others. The large shell is from a French 75mm gun. The smallest shell is a British 1-pounder with a risque female figures on it. The casing which retains the projectile is a 37 mm and is marked "souvenir of the Argonne Forest."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
